verses.text: \w Hear|strong="H8085"\w* ye the \w word|strong="H1697"\w* which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w speaketh|strong="H1696"\w* unto you, O \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*:

Thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \w Learn|strong="H3925"\w* not the \w way|strong="H1870"\w* of the \w heathen|strong="H1471"\w*, and be not \w dismayed|strong="H2865"\w* at the \w signs|strong="H0226"\w* of \w heaven|strong="H8064"\w*; for the \w heathen|strong="H1471"\w* are \w dismayed|strong="H2865"\w* at \w them|strong="H1992"\w*.

For the \w customs|strong="H2708"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \add are\add* \w vain|strong="H1892"\w*: for \add one\add* \w cutteth|strong="H3772"\w* a \w tree|strong="H6086"\w* out of the \w forest|strong="H3293"\w*, the \w work|strong="H4639"\w* of the \w hands|strong="H3027"\w* of the \w workman|strong="H2796"\w*, with the \w axe|strong="H4621"\w*.\f + \fr 10.3 \ft customs…: Heb. statutes, or, ordinances are vanity\f*

They \w deck|strong="H3302"\w* it with \w silver|strong="H3701"\w* and with \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*; they \w fasten|strong="H2388"\w* it with \w nails|strong="H4548"\w* and with \w hammers|strong="H4717"\w*, that it \w move|strong="H6328"\w* not.

They \add are\add* \w upright|strong="H4749"\w* as the palm \w tree|strong="H8560"\w*, but \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* not: they must \w needs|strong="H5375"\w* be \w borne|strong="H5375"\w*, because they cannot \w go|strong="H6805"\w*. Be not \w afraid|strong="H3372"\w* of them; for they cannot do \w evil|strong="H7489"\w*, neither also \add is it\add* in them to do \w good|strong="H3190"\w*.

Forasmuch as \add there is\add* none like unto thee, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; thou \add art\add* \w great|strong="H1419"\w*, and thy \w name|strong="H8034"\w* \add is\add* \w great|strong="H1419"\w* in \w might|strong="H1369"\w*.

Who would not \w fear|strong="H3372"\w* thee, O \w King|strong="H4428"\w* of \w nations|strong="H1471"\w*? for to thee doth it \w appertain|strong="H2969"\w*: forasmuch as among all the \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \add men\add* of the \w nations|strong="H1471"\w*, and in all their \w kingdoms|strong="H4438"\w*, \add there is\add* none like unto thee.\f + \fr 10.7 \ft to…: or, it liketh thee\f*

But they are \w altogether|strong="H0259"\w* \w brutish|strong="H1197"\w* and \w foolish|strong="H3688"\w*: the \w stock|strong="H6086"\w* \add is\add* a \w doctrine|strong="H4148"\w* of \w vanities|strong="H1892"\w*.\f + \fr 10.8 \ft altogether: Heb. in one, or, at once\f*

\w Silver|strong="H3701"\w* spread into \w plates|strong="H7554"\w* is \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* from \w Tarshish|strong="H8659"\w*, and \w gold|strong="H2091"\w* from \w Uphaz|strong="H0210"\w*, the \w work|strong="H4639"\w* of the \w workman|strong="H2796"\w*, and of the \w hands|strong="H3027"\w* of the \w founder|strong="H6884"\w*: \w blue|strong="H8504"\w* and \w purple|strong="H0713"\w* \add is\add* their \w clothing|strong="H3830"\w*: they \add are\add* all the \w work|strong="H4639"\w* of \w cunning|strong="H2450"\w* \add men\add*.

But the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* the \w true|strong="H0571"\w* \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, he \add is\add* the \w living|strong="H2416"\w* \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, and an \w everlasting|strong="H5769"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w*: at his \w wrath|strong="H7110"\w* the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w* shall \w tremble|strong="H7493"\w*, and the \w nations|strong="H1471"\w* shall not be able to \w abide|strong="H3557"\w* his \w indignation|strong="H2195"\w*.\f + \fr 10.10 \ft true…: Heb. God of truth\f*\f + \fr 10.10 \ft living God: Heb. living Gods\f*\f + \fr 10.10 \ft everlasting…: Heb. king of eternity\f*

\w Thus|strong="H1836"\w* shall ye \w say|strong="H0560"\w* unto them, The \w gods|strong="H0426"\w* that have \w not|strong="H3809"\w* \w made|strong="H5648"\w* the \w heavens|strong="H8065"\w* and the \w earth|strong="H0778"\w*, \add even\add* they shall \w perish|strong="H0007"\w* from the \w earth|strong="H0772"\w*, and from \w under|strong="H8460"\w* \w these|strong="H0429"\w* \w heavens|strong="H8065"\w*.

He hath \w made|strong="H6213"\w* the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w* by his \w power|strong="H3581"\w*, he hath \w established|strong="H3559"\w* the \w world|strong="H8398"\w* by his \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w*, and hath stretched \w out|strong="H5186"\w* the \w heavens|strong="H8064"\w* by his \w discretion|strong="H8394"\w*.

When he \w uttereth|strong="H5414"\w* his \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*, \add there is\add* a \w multitude|strong="H1995"\w* of \w waters|strong="H4325"\w* in the \w heavens|strong="H8064"\w*, and he causeth the \w vapours|strong="H5387"\w* to \w ascend|strong="H5927"\w* from the \w ends|strong="H7097"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*; he \w maketh|strong="H6213"\w* \w lightnings|strong="H1300"\w* with \w rain|strong="H4306"\w*, and bringeth \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* the \w wind|strong="H7307"\w* out of his \w treasures|strong="H0214"\w*.\f + \fr 10.13 \ft multitude: or, noise\f*\f + \fr 10.13 \ft with: or, for\f*

Every \w man|strong="H0120"\w* is \w brutish|strong="H1197"\w* in \add his\add* \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w*: every \w founder|strong="H6884"\w* is \w confounded|strong="H3001"\w* by the graven \w image|strong="H6459"\w*: for his molten \w image|strong="H5262"\w* \add is\add* \w falsehood|strong="H8267"\w*, and \add there is\add* no \w breath|strong="H7307"\w* in them.\f + \fr 10.14 \ft brutish in his knowledge: or, more brutish than to know\f*

They \add are\add* \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*, \add and\add* the \w work|strong="H4639"\w* of \w errors|strong="H8595"\w*: in the \w time|strong="H6256"\w* of their \w visitation|strong="H6486"\w* they shall \w perish|strong="H0006"\w*.

The \w portion|strong="H2506"\w* of \w Jacob|strong="H3290"\w* \add is\add* not like them: for he \add is\add* the \w former|strong="H3335"\w* of all \add things;\add* and \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* \add is\add* the \w rod|strong="H7626"\w* of his \w inheritance|strong="H5159"\w*: The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w* \add is\add* his \w name|strong="H8034"\w*.

¶ Gather \w up|strong="H0622"\w* thy \w wares|strong="H3666"\w* out of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*, O \w inhabitant|strong="H3427"\w* of the \w fortress|strong="H4692"\w*.\f + \fr 10.17 \ft inhabitant: Heb. inhabitress\f*

For thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Behold, I will \w sling|strong="H7049"\w* out the \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* at this \w once|strong="H6471"\w*, and will \w distress|strong="H6887"\w* them, that they may \w find|strong="H4672"\w* \add it so\add*.

¶ \w Woe|strong="H0188"\w* is me for my \w hurt|strong="H7667"\w*! my \w wound|strong="H4347"\w* is \w grievous|strong="H2470"\w*: but I \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Truly|strong="H0389"\w* this \add is\add* a \w grief|strong="H2483"\w*, and I must \w bear|strong="H5375"\w* it.

My \w tabernacle|strong="H0168"\w* is \w spoiled|strong="H7703"\w*, and all my \w cords|strong="H4340"\w* are \w broken|strong="H5423"\w*: my \w children|strong="H1121"\w* are gone \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* of me, and they \add are\add* not: \add there is\add* none to stretch \w forth|strong="H5186"\w* my \w tent|strong="H0168"\w* any more, and to set \w up|strong="H6965"\w* my \w curtains|strong="H3407"\w*.

For the \w pastors|strong="H7462"\w* are become \w brutish|strong="H1197"\w*, and have not \w sought|strong="H1875"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: therefore they shall not \w prosper|strong="H7919"\w*, and all their \w flocks|strong="H4830"\w* shall be \w scattered|strong="H6327"\w*.

Behold, the \w noise|strong="H6963"\w* of the \w bruit|strong="H8052"\w* is \w come|strong="H0935"\w*, and a \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w commotion|strong="H7494"\w* out of the \w north|strong="H6828"\w* \w country|strong="H0776"\w*, to \w make|strong="H7760"\w* the \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* \w desolate|strong="H8077"\w*, \add and\add* a \w den|strong="H4583"\w* of \w dragons|strong="H8577"\w*.

¶ O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, I \w know|strong="H3045"\w* that the \w way|strong="H1870"\w* of \w man|strong="H0120"\w* \add is\add* not in himself: \add it is\add* not in \w man|strong="H0376"\w* that \w walketh|strong="H1980"\w* to \w direct|strong="H3559"\w* his \w steps|strong="H6806"\w*.

O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \w correct|strong="H3256"\w* me, but with \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*; not in thine \w anger|strong="H0639"\w*, lest thou bring me to \w nothing|strong="H4591"\w*.\f + \fr 10.24 \ft bring…: Heb. diminish me\f*

Pour \w out|strong="H8210"\w* thy \w fury|strong="H2534"\w* upon the \w heathen|strong="H1471"\w* that \w know|strong="H3045"\w* thee not, and upon the \w families|strong="H4940"\w* that \w call|strong="H7121"\w* not on thy \w name|strong="H8034"\w*: for they have eaten \w up|strong="H0398"\w* \w Jacob|strong="H3290"\w*, and \w devoured|strong="H0398"\w* him, and \w consumed|strong="H3615"\w* him, and have made his \w habitation|strong="H5116"\w* \w desolate|strong="H8074"\w*.
